alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Granville; Vance; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 10:20AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Vance, southeastern Granville, northeastern Wake and northwestern Franklin Counties through 1100 AM EDT... At 1019 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Creedmoor to near Wake Forest to near Raleigh. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Henderson, Creedmoor, Louisburg, Wake Forest, Franklinton, Kittrell, Rolesville, Youngsville and Falls Lake State Rec Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
